blocks.name: cfzo
blocks.content: Syntax for half-open integer ranges.
blocks.origin: const class cfzo { ..^ }

blocks.name: diff.cfzo.s
diff.cfzo.c
diff.cfzo.w
df-fzo
blocks.content: Define a function generating sets of integers using a _half-open_ range. Read ` ( M ..^ N ) ` as the integers from ` M ` up to, but not including, ` N ` ; contrast with ` ( M ... N ) ` ~ df-fz , which includes ` N ` . Not including the endpoint simplifies a number of formulas related to cardinality and splitting; contrast ~ fzosplit with ~ fzsplit , for instance. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 14-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: fzof
blocks.content: Functionality of the half-open integer set function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 14-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzof() {
  |- wf(cfzo, cxp(cz, cz), cpw(cz))
} = {
  mpbi(wf(cfzo, cxp(cz, cz), cpw(cz)), wral(hs0, cz, wral(hs1, cz, wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), cpw(cz)))))
  rgen2w(hs0, hs1, cz, cz, wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), cpw(cz)))
  mpbir(wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), cpw(cz)), wss(co(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), cz))
  fzssz(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1))
  elpw(co(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), cz)
  ovex(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1))
  fmpt2(hs0, hs1, cz, cz, co(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), cpw(cz), cfzo)
  df-fzo(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(cz))
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs1.c(cpw(cz))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fzof() {
  ⊢ (..^ :(ℤ × ℤ)→ P(ℤ))
} = {
  mpbi((..^ :(ℤ × ℤ)→ P(ℤ)), ∀(hs0 ∈ ℤ, ∀(hs1 ∈ ℤ,(hs0[...](hs1[-]1))∈ P(ℤ))))
  rgen2w(hs0, hs1, cz, cz, (hs0[...](hs1[-]1))∈ P(ℤ))
  mpbir((hs0[...](hs1[-]1))∈ P(ℤ), (hs0[...](hs1[-]1))⊆ ℤ)
  fzssz(hs0, (hs1[-]1))
  elpw((hs0[...](hs1[-]1)), cz)
  ovex(hs0, cfz, (hs1[-]1))
  fmpt2(hs0, hs1, cz, cz, (hs0[...](hs1[-]1)), P(ℤ), cfzo)
  df-fzo(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(P(ℤ))
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs1.c(P(ℤ))
}

blocks.name: fzoval
blocks.content: Value of the half-open integer set in terms of the closed integer set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 14-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzoval(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cz), wceq(co(c1, cfzo, c0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))))
} = {
  pm2.61ian(wcel(c0, cz), wceq(co(c1, cfzo, c0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(c1, cz))
  ovmpt2a(hs0, hs1, c1, cz, c0, cz, cfzo, co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), co(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)))
  oveqan12d(cv(hs0), cfz, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1), c1, co(c0, cmin, nat1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  oveq1(cv(hs1), c0, cmin, nat1)
  df-fzo(hs0, hs1)
  ovex(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))
  adantr(wn(wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c0, cz), wceq(co(c1, cfzo, c0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))))
  eqtr4d(co(c1, cfzo, c0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), emptycls, wn(wcel(c1, cz)))
  syl(wn(wcel(c1, cz)), wceq(co(c1, cfzo, c0), emptycls), wn(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz))))
  con3i(wcel(c1, cz), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)))
  simpl(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  ndmov(c1, cz, c0, cfzo)
  fdmi(cfzo, cxp(cz, cz), cpw(cz))
  fzof()
  syl(wn(wcel(c1, cz)), wceq(co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), emptycls), wn(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cz))))
  con3i(wcel(c1, cz), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cz)))
  simpl(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cz))
  ndmov(c1, cz, co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfz)
  fdmi(cfz, cxp(cz, cz), cpw(cz))
  fzf()
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fzoval(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℤ →(c1[..^]c0)=(c1[...](c0[-]1)))
} = {
  pm2.61ian(c0 ∈ ℤ, (c1[..^]c0)=(c1[...](c0[-]1)), c1 ∈ ℤ)
  ovmpt2a(hs0, hs1, c1, cz, c0, cz, cfzo, (c1[...](c0[-]1)), (hs0[...](hs1[-]1)))
  oveqan12d(hs0, cfz, (hs1[-]1), c1, (c0[-]1), hs0 = c1, hs1 = c0)
  id(hs0 = c1)
  oveq1(hs1, c0, cmin, nat1)
  df-fzo(hs0, hs1)
  ovex(c1, cfz, (c0[-]1))
  adantr(¬ c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ, (c1[..^]c0)=(c1[...](c0[-]1)))
  eqtr4d((c1[..^]c0), (c1[...](c0[-]1)), emptycls, ¬ c1 ∈ ℤ)
  syl(¬ c1 ∈ ℤ, (c1[..^]c0)= ∅, ¬(c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0 ∈ ℤ))
  con3i(c1 ∈ ℤ, (c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0 ∈ ℤ))
  simpl(c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  ndmov(c1, cz, c0, cfzo)
  fdmi(cfzo, (ℤ × ℤ), P(ℤ))
  fzof()
  syl(¬ c1 ∈ ℤ, (c1[...](c0[-]1))= ∅, ¬(c1 ∈ ℤ ∧(c0[-]1)∈ ℤ))
  con3i(c1 ∈ ℤ, (c1 ∈ ℤ ∧(c0[-]1)∈ ℤ))
  simpl(c1 ∈ ℤ, (c0[-]1)∈ ℤ)
  ndmov(c1, cz, (c0[-]1), cfz)
  fdmi(cfz, (ℤ × ℤ), P(ℤ))
  fzf()
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((c1[...](c0[-]1)))
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c((c1[...](c0[-]1)))
}

blocks.name: elfzo
blocks.content: Membership in a half-open finite set of integers. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfzo(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))))
} = {
  3bitr4d(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2)), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, co(c2, cmin, nat1))), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, nat1))))
  syl3an3(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, co(c2, cmin, nat1))), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, nat1)))), wcel(co(c2, cmin, nat1), cz))
  peano2zm(c2)
  elfz(c0, c1, co(c2, cmin, nat1))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, co(c2, cmin, nat1)))))
  eleq2d(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2), co(c1, cfz, co(c2, cmin, nat1)), wcel(c2, cz))
  fzoval(c2, c1)
  anbi2d(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2), wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, nat1)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wb(wbr(c0, clt, c2), wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, nat1))))
  zltlem1(c0, c2)
}

blocks.name: elfzo2
blocks.content: Membership in a half-open integer interval. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfzo2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2)))
} = {
  3bitr4i(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2)), wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))))
  3bitr4i(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))), wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))), wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c1, cle, c0)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))))
  an4(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))
  anbi1i(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, cz)))
  df-3an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  anbi1i(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c1, cle, c0)))
  3bitri(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c1, cle, c0)), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0)))
  eluz2(c0, c1)
  3ancoma(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  df-3an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  biadanii(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2)))
  3jca(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  elfzoelz(c0, c1, c2)
  elfzoel1(c0, c1, c2)
  elfzoel2(c0, c1, c2)
  elfzo(c0, c1, c2)
  3anass(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))
}

blocks.name: nelfzo
blocks.content: An integer not being a member of a half-open finite set of integers. (Contributed by AV, 29-Apr-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm nelfzo(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wb(wnel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wo(wbr(c0, clt, c1), wbr(c2, cle, c0))))
} = {
  syl5bb(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wnel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wo(wbr(c0, clt, c1), wbr(c2, cle, c0)), wn(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2))))
  df-nel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2))
  3bitr4d(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wn(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2))), wo(wbr(c0, clt, c1), wbr(c2, cle, c0)), wn(wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))), wo(wn(wbr(c1, cle, c0)), wn(wbr(c0, clt, c2))))
  a1i(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wb(wn(wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))), wo(wn(wbr(c1, cle, c0)), wn(wbr(c0, clt, c2)))))
  ianor(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))
  notbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, c2)))
  elfzo(c0, c1, c2)
  orbi12d(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c0, clt, c1), wbr(c2, cle, c0), wn(wbr(c1, cle, c0)), wn(wbr(c0, clt, c2)))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, clt, c1), wn(wbr(c1, cle, c0))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  anim12i(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr))
  zre(c1)
  ltnle(c0, c1)
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wb(wbr(c2, cle, c0), wn(wbr(c0, clt, c2))), wa(wcel(c2, cr), wcel(c0, cr)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wa(wcel(c2, cr), wcel(c0, cr)))
  anim12ci(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c2, cr), wcel(c0, cr))
  zre(c0)
  zre(c2)
  lenlt(c2, c0)
}

blocks.name: fzolb
blocks.content: The left endpoint of a half-open integer interval is in the set iff the two arguments are integers with ` M < N ` . This provides an alternative notation for the "strict upper integer" predicate by analogy to the "weak upper integer" predicate ` M e. ( ZZ>= `` N ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: fzolb2
blocks.content: The left endpoint of a half-open integer interval is in the set iff the two arguments are integers with ` M < N ` . This provides an alternative notation for the "strict upper integer" predicate by analogy to the "weak upper integer" predicate ` M e. ( ZZ>= `` N ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzole1
blocks.content: A member in a half-open integer interval is greater than or equal to the lower bound. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzolt2
blocks.content: A member in a half-open integer interval is less than the upper bound. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzolt3
blocks.content: Membership in a half-open integer interval implies that the bounds are unequal. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzolt2b
blocks.content: A member in a half-open integer interval is less than the upper bound. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzolt3b
blocks.content: Membership in a half-open integer interval implies that the bounds are unequal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: fzonel
blocks.content: A half-open range does not contain its right endpoint. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 25-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzouz2
blocks.content: The upper bound of a half-open range is greater than or equal to an element of the range. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfzouz2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2))
  mpd(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c0, clt, c2))
  elfzolt2(c0, c1, c2)
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wi(wbr(c0, clt, c2), wbr(c0, cle, c2)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  elfzoelz(c0, c1, c2)
  elfzoel2(c0, c1, c2)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wi(wbr(c0, clt, c2), wbr(c0, cle, c2)), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c2, cr))
  zre(c0)
  zre(c2)
  ltle(c0, c2)
  eluz2(c2, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elfzouz2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(c1[..^]c2)→ c2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(c0 ∈(c1[..^]c2), c2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0), c0 ∈ ℤ, c2 ∈ ℤ, c0[≤]c2)
  mpd(c0 ∈(c1[..^]c2), c0[≤]c2, c0[<]c2)
  elfzolt2(c0, c1, c2)
  syl2anc(c0 ∈(c1[..^]c2), (c0[<]c2 → c0[≤]c2), c0 ∈ ℤ, c2 ∈ ℤ)
  elfzoelz(c0, c1, c2)
  elfzoel2(c0, c1, c2)
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℤ, c2 ∈ ℤ, (c0[<]c2 → c0[≤]c2), c0 ∈ ℝ, c2 ∈ ℝ)
  zre(c0)
  zre(c2)
  ltle(c0, c2)
  eluz2(c2, c0)
}

blocks.name: elfzofz
blocks.content: A half-open range is contained in the corresponding closed range. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 23-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzo3
blocks.content: Express membership in a half-open integer interval in terms of the "less than or equal to" and "less than" predicates on integers, resp. ` K e. ( ZZ>= `` M ) <-> M <_ K ` , ` K e. ( K ..^ N ) <-> K < N ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfzo3(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c0, co(c0, cfzo, c2))))
} = {
  3bitr4i(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c0, co(c0, cfzo, c2))), w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))))
  3anass(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))
  elfzo2(c0, c1, c2)
  pm5.32i(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c0, co(c0, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wb(wcel(c0, co(c0, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))), wcel(c0, cz))
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  baib(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c0, co(c0, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2)))
  bitri(wcel(c0, co(c0, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2)))
  fzolb(c0, c2)
  3anass(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c2))
}

blocks.name: fzon0
blocks.content: A half-open integer interval is nonempty iff it contains its left endpoint. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: fzossfz
blocks.content: A half-open range is contained in the corresponding closed range. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 23-Aug-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: fzon
blocks.content: A half-open set of sequential integers is empty if the bounds are equal or reversed. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Oct-2017.)

blocks.name: fzo0n
blocks.content: A half-open range of nonnegative integers is empty iff the upper bound is not positive. (Contributed by AV, 2-May-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: fzonlt0
blocks.content: A half-open integer range is empty if the bounds are equal or reversed. (Contributed by AV, 20-Oct-2018.)

blocks.name: fzo0
blocks.content: Half-open sets with equal endpoints are empty. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: fzonnsub
blocks.content: If ` K < N ` then ` N - K ` is a positive integer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 1-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: fzonnsub2
blocks.content: If ` M < N ` then ` N - M ` is a positive integer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: fzodisj
blocks.content: Abutting half-open integer ranges are disjoint. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 14-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzodisj(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(cin(co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c1, cfzo, c2)), emptycls)
} = {
  mpgbir(hs0, wceq(cin(co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c1, cfzo, c2)), emptycls), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfzo, c2)))))
  disj1(hs0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), co(c1, cfzo, c2))
  nsyl(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)))
  mpbid(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)), wn(wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c1))
  elfzolt2(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  ltnled(cv(hs0), c1, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)))
  zred(cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)))
  elfzoelz(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  zred(c1, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)))
  elfzoel2(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  elfzole1(cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cfzo, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(co(c1, cfzo, c2))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fzodisj(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0[..^]c1)⋂(c1[..^]c2))= ∅
} = {
  mpgbir(hs0, ((c0[..^]c1)⋂(c1[..^]c2))= ∅, (hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1)→ ¬ hs0 ∈(c1[..^]c2)))
  disj1(hs0, (c0[..^]c1), (c1[..^]c2))
  nsyl(hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1), hs0 ∈(c1[..^]c2), c1[≤]hs0)
  mpbid(hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1), ¬ c1[≤]hs0, hs0[<]c1)
  elfzolt2(hs0, c0, c1)
  ltnled(hs0, c1, hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1))
  zred(hs0, hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1))
  elfzoelz(hs0, c0, c1)
  zred(c1, hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1))
  elfzoel2(hs0, c0, c1)
  elfzole1(hs0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[..^]c1))
  diff.hs0.c((c1[..^]c2))
}

blocks.name: fzouzdisj
blocks.content: A half-open integer range does not overlap the upper integer range starting at the endpoint of the first range. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Sep-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzouzdisj(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cin(co(c0, cfzo, c1), cfv(cuz, c1)), emptycls)

  nn0z(c2)

  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cn0)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, co(c0, caddc, c2)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c1, cle, c0))

blocks.name: fzodisjsn
blocks.content: A half-open integer range and the singleton of its upper bound are disjoint. (Contributed by AV, 7-Mar-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzodisjsn(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cin(co(c0, cfzo, c1), csn(c1)), emptycls)

  disj1(hs0, co(c0, cfzo, c1), csn(c1))
  nsyl(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), csn(c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  neneqd(cv(hs0), c1, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)))
  ltned(cv(hs0), c1, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)))
  zred(cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfzo, c1)))
  elfzoelz(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  elfzolt2(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  elsni(cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cfzo, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(csn(c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fzodisjsn(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0[..^]c1)⋂ { c1 })= ∅
} = {
  mpgbir(hs0, ((c0[..^]c1)⋂ { c1 })= ∅, (hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1)→ ¬ hs0 ∈ { c1 }))
  disj1(hs0, (c0[..^]c1), { c1 })
  nsyl(hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1), hs0 ∈ { c1 }, hs0 = c1)
  neneqd(hs0, c1, hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1))
  ltned(hs0, c1, hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1))
  zred(hs0, hs0 ∈(c0[..^]c1))
  elfzoelz(hs0, c0, c1)
  elfzolt2(hs0, c0, c1)
  elsni(hs0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[..^]c1))
  diff.hs0.c({ c1 })
}

blocks.name: elfzo0le
blocks.content: A member in a half-open range of nonnegative integers is less than or equal to the upper bound of the range. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Sep-2018.)

blocks.name: elfzonn0
blocks.content: A member of a half-open range of nonnegative integers is a nonnegative integer. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-May-2018.)

blocks.name: fzonmapblen
blocks.content: The result of subtracting a nonnegative integer from a positive integer and adding another nonnegative integer which is less than the first one is less than the positive integer. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-May-2018.)

  sylbi(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c0, clt, c1)))
  elfzo0(c0, c1)
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c0, clt, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  anim12i(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr))
  nn0re(c0)
  nnre(c1)

blocks.name: fzofzim

  0red(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))

blocks.pretty:
thm elfzo1(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(1[..^]c1)↔(c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c0[<]c1))
} = {
  impbii(c0 ∈(1[..^]c1), (c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c0[<]c1))
  3jca(c0 ∈(1[..^]c1), c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, c0[<]c1)
  syl2anc(c0 ∈(1[..^]c1), c1 ∈ ℕ, c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0))
  sseli(c0, (1[..^]c1), cn)
  fzossnn(c1)
  elfzouz2(c0, nat1, c1)
  eluznn(c0, c1)
  elfzolt2(c0, nat1, c1)
  sylibr((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c0[<]c1), c0 ∈(1[..^]c1), (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 1)∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0[<]c1))
  3anim123i(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, c0[<]c1, c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 1), c1 ∈ ℤ, c0[<]c1)
  sseli(c0, cn, (ℤ≥ ` 1))

  nnz(c1)
  id(c0[<]c1)
  elfzo2(c0, nat1, c1)
}

blocks.name: fzo0n0
blocks.content: A half-open integer range based at 0 is nonempty precisely if the upper bound is a positive integer. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Sep-2015.)

  zred(c2, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c2, cz))

  sylan(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c3), cz), wcel(c0, cz))

thm fzoaddel2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, c2))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c2), co(c2, cfzo, c1)))
} = {
  eleqtrd(co(c0, caddc, c2), co(c2, cfzo, c1), co(co(nat0, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(co(c1, cmin, c2), caddc, c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, c2))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, c2))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c2), co(co(nat0, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(co(c1, cmin, c2), caddc, c2))))
  fzoaddel(c0, nat0, co(c1, cmin, c2), c2)
  3adant1(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, c2))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wceq(co(co(nat0, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(co(c1, cmin, c2), caddc, c2)), co(c2, cfzo, c1)))
  syl2an(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wceq(co(co(nat0, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(co(c1, cmin, c2), caddc, c2)), co(c2, cfzo, c1)), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc))
  zcn(c1)
  zcn(c2)
  oveq12d(co(nat0, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(co(c1, cmin, c2), caddc, c2), c2, c1, wa(wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)))
  adantl(wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wceq(co(nat0, caddc, c2), c2))
  addid2(c2)
  npcan(c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: elfzoext
blocks.content: Membership of an integer in an extended open range of integers. (Contributed by AV, 30-Apr-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfzoext(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3))))
} = {
  imp(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3))))
  mpand(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wcel(c2, cz))
  elfzoel2(c0, c1, c2)
  expcom(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cn0)), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3))))
  sselda(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2), co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cn0)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cn0)), wss(co(c1, cfzo, c2), co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wcel(co(c2, caddc, c3), cfv(cuz, c2)))
  eqeltrd(co(c2, caddc, c3), cfv(cuz, c2), co(c3, caddc, c2), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cn0)))
  syl2an(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cn0), wceq(co(c2, caddc, c3), co(c3, caddc, c2)), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(c3, cc))
  zcn(c2)
  nn0cn(c3)
  addcom(c2, c3)
  ancoms(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(co(c3, caddc, c2), cfv(cuz, c2)))
  nn0pzuz(c3, c2)
  fzoss2(co(c2, caddc, c3), c2, c1)
}

blocks.name: elincfzoext
blocks.content: Membership of an increased integer in a correspondingly extended half-open range of integers. (Contributed by AV, 30-Apr-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm elincfzoext(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c3), co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3))))
} = {
  mpbir2and(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c3), co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)), wbr(co(c0, caddc, c3), clt, co(c2, caddc, c3)))
  imp(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)))
  mpd(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wi(wcel(c3, cn0), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3))), wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  elfzole1(c0, c1, c2)
  exp31(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wcel(c3, cn0), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)))
  mpd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wbr(c1, cle, c0)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)), wbr(c0, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)))
  sylan(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wbr(c1, cle, c0)), wcel(c3, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)), wcel(c0, cr))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wcel(c0, cr))
  nn0addge1(c0, c3)
  imp31(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wcel(c3, cn0), wi(wbr(c0, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3))))
  com23(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wcel(c3, cn0), wi(wbr(c0, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3))))
  exp4b(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wi(wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3))), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3))), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c3), cr))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c1, cr))
  zred(c1, wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)))
  readdcld(c0, c3, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)))
  letr(c1, c0, co(c0, caddc, c3))
  ltadd1dd(c0, c3, c2, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c0, cr))
  zred(c0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c2, cr))
  zred(c2, wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c3, cr))
  nn0re(c3)
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wbr(c0, clt, c2))
  elfzolt2(c0, c1, c2)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)), wb(wcel(co(c0, caddc, c3), co(c1, cfzo, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wa(wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c3)), wbr(co(c0, caddc, c3), clt, co(c2, caddc, c3)))), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c3), cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c2, caddc, c3), cz))
  zaddcld(c0, c3, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c0, cz))
  elfzoelz(c0, c1, c2)
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c1, cz))
  elfzoel1(c0, c1, c2)
  zaddcld(c2, c3, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c2, cz))
  elfzoel2(c0, c1, c2)
  adantl(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cn0), wcel(c3, cz))
  nn0z(c3)
  elfzo(co(c0, caddc, c3), c1, co(c2, caddc, c3))
}

blocks.name: fzosubel
blocks.content: Translate membership in a half-open integer range. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzosubel(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c3), co(co(c1, cmin, c3), cfzo, co(c2, cmin, c3))))
} = {
  3eltr3d(co(c0, cmin, c3), co(co(c1, cmin, c3), cfzo, co(c2, cmin, c3)), co(c0, caddc, cneg(c3)), co(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c3)), cfzo, co(c2, caddc, cneg(c3))), wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(co(c0, caddc, cneg(c3)), co(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c3)), cfzo, co(c2, caddc, cneg(c3)))), wcel(cneg(c3), cz))
  znegcl(c3)
  fzoaddel(c0, c1, c2, cneg(c3))
  negsubd(c0, c3, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  zcnd(c0, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  elfzoelz(c0, c1, c2)
  oveq12d(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c3)), cfzo, co(c2, caddc, cneg(c3)), co(c1, cmin, c3), co(c2, cmin, c3), wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  negsubd(c1, c3, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  zcnd(c1, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  elfzoel1(c0, c1, c2)
  negsubd(c2, c3, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  zcnd(c2, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  elfzoel2(c0, c1, c2)
  zcnd(c3, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c3, cz))
}

blocks.name: fzosubel2
blocks.content: Membership in a translated half-open integer range implies translated membership in the original range. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzosubel2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c3))), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), co(c2, cfzo, c3)))
} = {
  eleqtrd(co(c0, cmin, c1), co(c2, cfzo, c3), co(co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cmin, c1), cfzo, co(co(c1, caddc, c3), cmin, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c3))), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))))
  3ad2antr1(wcel(c0, co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c3))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), co(co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cmin, c1), cfzo, co(co(c1, caddc, c3), cmin, c1))))
  fzosubel(c0, co(c1, caddc, c2), co(c1, caddc, c3), c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c3))), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz)), wceq(co(co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cmin, c1), cfzo, co(co(c1, caddc, c3), cmin, c1)), co(c2, cfzo, c3)))
  syl3an(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wceq(co(co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cmin, c1), cfzo, co(co(c1, caddc, c3), cmin, c1)), co(c2, cfzo, c3)), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(c3, cc))
  zcn(c1)
  zcn(c2)
  zcn(c3)
  oveq12d(co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cmin, c1), cfzo, co(co(c1, caddc, c3), cmin, c1), c2, c3, w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(c3, cc)))
  3adant3(wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(c3, cc), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cmin, c1), c2))
  pncan2(c1, c2)
  3adant2(wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(c3, cc), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, c3), cmin, c1), c3))
  pncan2(c1, c3)
}

blocks.name: fzosubel3
blocks.content: Membership in a translated half-open integer range when the original range is zero-based. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzosubel3(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), co(nat0, cfzo, c2)))
} = {
  syl13anc(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), co(nat0, cfzo, c2)), wcel(c0, co(co(c1, caddc, nat0), cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(nat0, cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  eleqtrrd(c0, co(co(c1, caddc, nat0), cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2)), co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz))
  oveq1d(co(c1, caddc, nat0), cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2), c1, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz)))
  addid1d(c1, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz)))
  zcnd(c1, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  elfzoel1(c0, c1, co(c1, caddc, c2))
  0zd(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfzo, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wcel(c2, cz))
  fzosubel2(c0, c1, nat0, c2)
}

blocks.name: eluzgtdifelfzo
blocks.content: Membership of the difference of integers in a half-open range of nonnegative integers. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Sep-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm eluzgtdifelfzo(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wi(wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0)), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c0), co(nat0, cfzo, co(c2, cmin, c1)))))
} = {
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0)), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c0), co(nat0, cfzo, co(c2, cmin, c1))))
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0))), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c0), co(nat0, cfzo, co(c2, cmin, c1))), wcel(c2, co(c0, cfzo, co(c0, caddc, co(c2, cmin, c1)))), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c1), cz))
  syl3anbrc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0))), wcel(c2, co(c0, cfzo, co(c0, caddc, co(c2, cmin, c1)))), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, co(c2, cmin, c1)), cz), wbr(c2, clt, co(c0, caddc, co(c2, cmin, c1))))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)))
  simpl(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0))
  zaddcld(c0, co(c2, cmin, c1), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0))))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0)), wcel(c0, cz))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  mpbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0))), wbr(c2, clt, co(c0, caddc, co(c2, cmin, c1))), wbr(c2, clt, co(c2, caddc, co(c0, cmin, c1))))
  mpbid(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0))), wbr(c2, clt, co(c2, caddc, co(c0, cmin, c1))), wbr(nat0, clt, co(c0, cmin, c1)))
  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0)), wbr(nat0, clt, co(c0, cmin, c1)))
  adantld(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0), wbr(nat0, clt, co(c0, cmin, c1)))
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wi(wbr(c1, clt, c0), wbr(nat0, clt, co(c0, cmin, c1))), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c0, cr))
  biimpd(wa(wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c0, cr)), wbr(c1, clt, c0), wbr(nat0, clt, co(c0, cmin, c1)))
  posdif(c1, c0)
  ltaddposd(co(c0, cmin, c1), c2, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0))))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), cr))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), cr), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr))
  zre(c0)
  zre(c1)
  resubcl(c0, c1)
  ad2antrl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0), wcel(c2, cr))
  eluzelre(c2, c0)
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0))), wb(wbr(c2, clt, co(c0, caddc, co(c2, cmin, c1))), wbr(c2, clt, co(c2, caddc, co(c0, cmin, c1)))), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wa(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  zcn(c0)

blocks.name: ssfzoulel
blocks.content: If a half-open integer range is a subset of a half-open range of nonnegative integers, but its lower bound is greater than or equal to the upper bound of the containing range, or its upper bound is less than or equal to 0, then its upper bound is less than or equal to its lower bound (and therefore it is actually empty). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 24-May-2018.)

  fzoval(c2, c1)

blocks.name: elfzom1b
blocks.content: An integer is a member of a 1-based finite set of sequential integers iff its predecessor is a member of the corresponding 0-based set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfzom1b(class c0, class c1) {

  adantl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(nat1, cfzo, c1), co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1))))
  fzoval(c1, nat1)

  3ad2ant1(wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2)), wcel(c3, cz), wbr(c1, clt, c3), wi(wn(wcel(c1, co(c2, cfzo, c0))), wi(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1))))
  com23(wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2)), wn(wcel(c1, co(c2, cfzo, c0))), wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1))

blocks.name: fzonfzoufzol

blocks.origin:
thm fzonfzoufzol(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c1), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, c1))), wi(wn(wcel(c2, co(co(c1, cmin, c0), cfzo, c1))), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, c0)))))

  adantr(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c1), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, c1))), wn(wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, c0)))), wcel(co(c1, cmin, c0), cz))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, clt, c1), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, c1)), wcel(co(c1, cmin, c0), cz))
  impcom(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, c1)), wcel(co(c1, cmin, c0), cz))

}

blocks.origin:
thm elfzomelpfzo(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

} = {
  3bitr4g(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))), wcel(c2, co(co(c0, cmin, c3), cfzo, co(c1, cmin, c3))), wcel(co(c2, caddc, c3), co(c0, cfzo, c1)), w3a(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, co(c0, cmin, c3))), wcel(co(c1, cmin, c3), cz), wbr(c2, clt, co(c1, cmin, c3))), w3a(wcel(co(c2, caddc, c3), cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(c1, cz), wbr(co(c2, caddc, c3), clt, c1)))

  3anbi123d(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c3), cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(co(c0, cmin, c3), cle, c2), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c2, caddc, c3), cz), wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, caddc, c3)))

  ad2ant2rl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c3), cz))
  zsubcl(c0, c3)
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(c0, cz))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  2thd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(co(c2, caddc, c3), cz))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(c2, cz))
  simpl(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(co(c2, caddc, c3), cz))
  zaddcl(c2, c3)
  lesubaddd(c0, c3, c2, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(c0, cr))

blocks.name: elfznelfzo
blocks.content: A value in a finite set of sequential integers is a border value if it is not contained in the half-open integer range contained in the finite set of sequential integers. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Oct-2017.) (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 22-Dec-2021.)

thm elfznelfzo(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wn(wcel(c0, co(nat1, cfzo, c1)))), wo(wceq(c0, nat0), wceq(c0, c1)))

  elfz2nn0(c0, c1)
  sylbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wn(wcel(c0, co(nat1, cfzo, c1))), wo(wceq(c0, nat0), wceq(c0, c1)), wn(wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))))
  notbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c0, co(nat1, cfzo, c1)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, nat1))))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wb(wcel(c0, co(nat1, cfzo, c1)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), co(nat0, cfzo, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  anim12i(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))

blocks.name: fzosplitsni

blocks.name: fzisfzounsn
blocks.content: A finite interval of integers as union of a half-open integer range and a singleton. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Jun-2018.)

blocks.name: elfzr
blocks.content: A member of a finite interval of integers is either a member of the corresponding half-open integer range or the upper bound of the interval. (Contributed by AV, 5-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: fzind2
blocks.content: Induction on the integers from ` M ` to ` N ` inclusive. The first four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need; the last two are the basis and the induction step. Version of ~ fzind using integer range definitions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Feb-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzind2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), w0)

  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)

  -| diffsw(s0, w3)

  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  sylbi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), w0, wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))))
  bitri(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), wa(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))))
  elfz2(c0, c1, c2)
  3bitr4i(wa(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), wa(wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))))
  anass(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  anbi1i(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, cz)))
  df-3an(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  anbi2i(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))))
  3anass(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))

  sylbir(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), w2, wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c1)))
  eluz2(c2, c1)
  sylan2b(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, c2)), wi(w3, w4), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, c2))))
  3anass(wcel(cv(s1), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, c2))
  impr(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(cv(s1), cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, c2)), wi(w3, w4))

blocks.name: injresinj
blocks.content: A function whose restriction is injective and the values of the remaining arguments are different from all other values is injective itself. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Oct-2017.)

blocks.name: subfzo0
blocks.content: The difference between two elements in a half-open range of nonnegative integers is greater than the negation of the upper bound and less than the upper bound of the range. (Contributed by AV, 20-Mar-2021.)
